column4: I've been trying to remove Python3.2 from my 11.10 system (so I can reinstall it) but standard package-removal steps are failing.
When I attempt to "apt-get remove Python3.2", I'm told that "subprocess installed post-installation script returned error" and it's still on my system. Any ideas?
can you pastebin the full output?
here's a paste of the output "sudo apt-get remove --purge python3 python 3.2" http://pastebin.com/ZrG425Ar
looking now
have you tried removing one at a time?
yes
did anything else change on your system before this began?  (maybe installing other versions of python from source or something?)
I've been running Python3.2 along-side the system's default Python2.7 for almost a year without problems. I do development and use Python's virtual environments to test under 3.2 and 2.4
have you tried to see what "/usr/lib/python3.2/io.py", line 60 is trying to do?
line 60 simplt reads "import _io" ... _io looks like a C-compiled module since I can't find it among the normal module list

This is the error I get with I try to run anything using Python3 or even start the interactive interpreter ... I was hoping to be able to just remove and re-install then discovered that I couldn't do that simply
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5003276/python-import-io
also http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7111025/pydev-fatal-error-python32-lib-io-py-line-60-in-module
I dug into those pages (and several others) when this first cropped up ... didn't help.
I see - I was just wondering from the second link whether there is a file naming conflict somewhere that creates the problem
you might also ask in #python
no naming conflict
I was wondering, what if I start removing the Python3 files manually and then
and then repair the package system
yeah - apt/dpkg can be a real pain with errors like that :-/
